device.when_you_check_this_box: When you check this box, calls from the user's own extension to themselves will not ring the extension. This allows them to dial their own number to get to voicemail.

device.number_data_content: Outside number you wish to reach
device.require_key_press_data_content: Do you want to require a key press to answer this call
device.keep_caller_id_data_content: If set to true it will use the caller-id of the caller
device.hide_from_contact_list_data_content: By checking this box, this endpoint will not be added automatically to the contact list of the devices of this platform
device.expire_seconds_data_content: Enter the expiration time of this device (in seconds)
device.closed_groups_data_content: If checked, this device will only be able to call the devices that are part of the same groups
device.caller_id_name_data_content: Define the Caller ID Name of this Device for In-House Calls (max. 30 chars).
device.caller_id_number_data_content: Define the Caller ID Number of this Device for In-House Calls.

device.music_on_hold_data_content: Select the media file that you want to be played by default when it's not set on a user or a device.
device.secure_rtp_help: Select if you want to enable SRTP or ZRTP to encrypt the audio for this device
device.t_38_data_content: When this option is enabled the media servers will attempt to use T.38 between this device/resource and the server.
device.ignore_completed_elsewhere_data_content: When checked supporting phones will show a call missed if it was part of a ring group answered elsewhere.
device.device_mac_address_data_content: Enter the MAC Address of this device formatted like: 1A:B2:C6:78:F0:3B
device.notify_when_unregistered_data_content: Do you want to notify the administrator each time this device unregisters
device.outbound_flags_data_content: Enter outbound flags this device requires to be present on the carrier(s). Type a comma between each flag in order to have multiple outbound flags (ex: flag1, flag2, flag3)
device.internal_ringtones_data_content: The alert info SIP header added when the call is from internal sources
device.external_ringtones_data_content: The alert info SIP header added when the call is from external sources
device.url_data_content: Enter the SIP url. Must look like 'sip:support@company.com'

menu.menu_tip: Ask a caller to push a menu option or dial an extension number
menu.name: Name
menu.prompt_record_pin_data_content: PIN to enter in order to allow users to record their own greetings
menu.allow_caller_to_dial_extensions_data_con: Check to allow the user to dial extensions from this menu
menu.continue_to_default_action_popover: If true, when caller dials an extension, call will be branched, once that branch finishes if menu has a default action set, that action will be executed
menu.greeting_message_data_content: Select the Greeting message that you want to use for this menu. If you select - Not set -, then no media file will be played.
menu.whitelist_of_numbers_data_content: List of numbers that users are allowed to dial when hunting (ex: ^[0-9]{0,11}$ is a simple regex catching a group of 0 to 11 numbers)
menu.blacklist_of_numbers_data_content: List of numbers that users are not allowed to dial when hunting (ex: ^[0-9]{0,11}$ is a simple regex catching a group of 0 to 11 numbers)
menu.number_of_retries_on_misdial_data_conten: Number of allowed retries when misdialing in this menu.
menu.timeout_for_dialing_data_content: Number of seconds allowed without pressing any key.
menu.extension_number_length_data_content: The maximum length of an extension. You can not set a length shorter than the length of the PIN set on this menu (ie: if you set this field to "2" but the PIN is set to "1234" then the system will automatically set this field to "4").
menu.allow_outside_recording_data_content: This option allows someone to dial into a menu from an outside number (i.e. their cell phone, landline, etc.) and enter the PIN for the menu to be able to re-record it.
menu.suppress_playing_of_invalid_entry_data_c: This option, when checked, will suppress the playing of 'Invalid Entry'.
menu.there_were_errors_on_the_form: There were errors on the form, please correct!
menu.are_you_sure_you_want_to_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this menu?
menu.interdigit_timeout_data_content: Number of seconds to wait after a digit has been pressed before considering the entry complete.

user.user_tip: Direct a caller to a specific user
user.connect_caller_to_user: Connect a caller to a user...
user.allow_this_user_to_call_themselves: Allow this user to call themselves.
user.when_you_check_this_box: When you check this box, calls from the user's own extension to themselves will ring the extension. If this box isn't checked, calls from the user's own extension to themselves will go to their voicemail.
user.voicemail_data_content: By checking this option, an email will be sent to the specified e-mail address each time this user gets a voicemail.
user.caller_id_name_data_content: Define the Caller ID Name of this User for In-House Calls (max. 30 chars). If the Caller ID Name of the device and of the user is not set, this Caller ID Name will be used.
user.caller_id_number_data_content: Define the Caller ID Number of this User for In-House Calls. If the Caller ID Number of the device and of the user is not set, this Caller ID Number will be used.
user.caller_id_name_data_content2: Define the Caller ID Name of this User for Outbound Calls (max. 30 chars). If the Caller ID Name of the device and of the user is not set, this Caller ID Name will be used.
user.caller_id_number_data_content2: Define the Caller ID Number of this User for Outbound Calls. If the Caller ID Number of the device and of the user is not set, this Caller ID Number will be used.
user.the_following_devices_are_mapped: The following devices are mapped to this user. If you're creating a user, you can add a Device and it will be automatically assigned to this new user once the user creation is completed.
user.add_a_new_device: Add a new device for this user
user.caller_id_name_data_content3: Define the Caller ID Name of this User for Emergency Calls.
user.caller_id_number_data_content3: Define the Caller ID Number of this User for Emergency Calls (max. 30 chars).
user.time_zone_data_content: Select the time zone of this user.
user.music_on_hold_data_content: Select the media file that you want to be played by default when it 's not set on a user or a device.
user.hide_from_contact_list_data_content: By checking this box, this endpoint will not be added automatically to the contact list of the devices of this platform
user.record_this_agent_data_content: By checking this box, this agent will be recorded even if the global setting for the queue is set to not record agents.
user.enable_call_forward_data_content: If checked, call forwarding feature will be enabled for user.
user.redirect_calls_to_data_content: Number to redirect calls to for the call-forwarding feature
user.bypass_users_phones_data_content: If this box is checked, it will prevent the user's phones from ringing. For example: If you want to ONLY ring a user's cellphone (and not their desk phone) - check this box.
user.require_key_press_data_content: Do you want this user to press a key to answer a call that has been call-forwarded
user.keep_caller_id_data_content: If checked, the caller-ID of the person being forwarded will display.  If not checked the caller-ID of the user will display.
user.direct_calls_only_data_content: If checked, it will only use the call forwarding if the user/device is rung directly and not when rung as a member of a group (ring group, ect).
user.id_data_content: In order to enable Hot Desking from another device, you'll need to provide an ID
user.require_pin_data_content: If checked the user will be required to enter their ID and a PIN
user.pin_data_content: PIN required to sign into a device.
user.check_if_you_want: Check if you want to stay logged in
user.check_if_you_want_data_content: Tick if you want to stay logged in on your other devices
user.devices_where_this_user: Devices where this user is currently logged in
user.this_user_is_not_logged: This user is not logged in to any other endpoints.
user.closed_groups_data_content: If checked the user will only be able to call the Users in his groups.
user.there_is_currently_no_devices: There is currently no devices linked to this user
user.there_were_errors_on_the_form: There were errors on the form, please correct!
user.are_you_sure_you_want_to_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
user.do_you_really_want_to_delete: Do you really want to delete this device?

preflow.title: Preflow
preflow.help: Preflow is an option to execute a callflow before any other callflow. It is set on the account level and will apply on any call using callflow for that account. It can be useful to activate call recording, or the missed call alert feature for example.

maxDigits.help: How many DTMFs to collect from the caller

applyTo.label: Apply To
applyTo.tooltip: Setting this field to "original" will revert the caller id and then apply the prepend, IE: if the caller id is already prepend'd then that will be lost. Setting it to "current" will keep the caller id as is, including any existing prepend, and simply add to it.

__comment: UI-1260: created common control for carrier selection

entityManager.header: Click on what you would like to configure:
entityManager.__comment: UI-2612: add toggle to hide/view system callflows

showSystemCallflows.title: Show All Callflows
showSystemCallflows.help: As an admin, you're allowed to see all the existing callflows in this page. This include "Applications" Callflows that are created by other apps, but that you don't necesserarily want to update. If you wish to reduce clutter, you can switch this off to hide these callflows.

node.confirmEnable: This node is disabled. Do you want to enable it?
